Line 85: Line 85:
On March 10, Dozens of jailed Kurds in Syria of ''Yakiti party'' and the ''Democratic Union'' started a hunger strike in solidarity with rights activists who have mounted the same action in a prison near Damascus three days earlier.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5j_unWcGEmBcNfMzgi2zu5xlRNDzw?docId=CNG.b10f77bcf3bb312a68aa8c85b50004d3.8e1 |title=Jailed Kurds on Syria hunger strike: rights group |publisher=AFP |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref> [[Human Rights Watch]] reacts to the disappearance of Syrian activits in Lebanon four days earlier and fears that [[Lebanon]] is "back to doing Syria's dirty job".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hrw.org/en/news/2011/03/09/lebanon-reveal-fate-disappeared-syrians |title=Lebanon: Reveal Fate of Disappeared Syrians |publisher=HRW |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref> Syrian Foreign Ministry stated that Syria is monitoring with high concern "the [[2011 Libyan uprising| tragic developments]] in the brotherly country of [[Libya]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dp-news.com/pages/detail.aspx?l=2&articleId=77422 |title=Syria respects Libya's Sovereignty |publisher=dp-news.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref> Syrian newspaper [[Al-Watan (Syria)| Al-Watan]] said that the Syrian government have welcomed the fall of [[Mubarak]]'s regime and are might be looking forward new leadership that does not "cover for Israeli violations".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://http://www.syria-today.com/index.php/politics/14482-life-after-mubarak |title=Life After Mubarak |publisher=syria-today.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref> [[Iran| Iranian]] official said that they support Syria's right to "restore the occupied [[Golan Heights| Golan]] under its sovereignty".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dp-news.com/pages/detail.aspx?l=2&articleId=77335 |title=Iran support Syria to restore the occupied Golan |publisher=dp-news.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref> [[Reform Party of Syria]] said that "[[Bashar al-Assad| al-Assad]] is sending arms to [[Gaddafi]] to kill his people with". <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worldtribune.com/worldtribune/WTARC/2011/me_libya0257_03_10.asp |title=Syrian pilots said to be flying Libyan fighter jets |publisher=World Tribune |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref>
On March 10, Dozens of jailed Kurds in Syria of ''Yakiti party'' and the ''Democratic Union'' started a hunger strike in solidarity with rights activists who have mounted the same action in a prison near Damascus three days earlier.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5j_unWcGEmBcNfMzgi2zu5xlRNDzw?docId=CNG.b10f77bcf3bb312a68aa8c85b50004d3.8e1 |title=Jailed Kurds on Syria hunger strike: rights group |publisher=AFP |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref> [[Human Rights Watch]] reacts to the disappearance of Syrian activits in Lebanon four days earlier and fears that [[Lebanon]] is "back to doing Syria's dirty job".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hrw.org/en/news/2011/03/09/lebanon-reveal-fate-disappeared-syrians |title=Lebanon: Reveal Fate of Disappeared Syrians |publisher=HRW |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref> Syrian Foreign Ministry stated that Syria is monitoring with high concern "the [[2011 Libyan uprising| tragic developments]] in the brotherly country of [[Libya]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dp-news.com/pages/detail.aspx?l=2&articleId=77422 |title=Syria respects Libya's Sovereignty |publisher=dp-news.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref> Syrian newspaper [[Al-Watan (Syria)| Al-Watan]] said that the Syrian government have welcomed the fall of [[Mubarak]]'s regime and are might be looking forward new leadership that does not "cover for Israeli violations".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://http://www.syria-today.com/index.php/politics/14482-life-after-mubarak |title=Life After Mubarak |publisher=syria-today.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref> [[Iran| Iranian]] official said that they support Syria's right to "restore the occupied [[Golan Heights| Golan]] under its sovereignty".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dp-news.com/pages/detail.aspx?l=2&articleId=77335 |title=Iran support Syria to restore the occupied Golan |publisher=dp-news.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref> [[Reform Party of Syria]] said that "[[Bashar al-Assad| al-Assad]] is sending arms to [[Gaddafi]] to kill his people with". <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worldtribune.com/worldtribune/WTARC/2011/me_libya0257_03_10.asp |title=Syrian pilots said to be flying Libyan fighter jets |publisher=World Tribune |date= |accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref>
  +   +
==== 15 March ====
  +
A new call for protests to take place on the 15th of March<ref>https://www.facebook.com/Syrian.Revolution</ref>
  +
==Reaction==
==Reaction==
On 29 January 2011, news channel [[Al Arabiya]] reported that Internet connection was cut off, that was quickly denied by official sources.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dp-news.com/pages/detail.aspx?l=2&articleId=72236 |title=Internet is Available across Syria |publisher=dp-news.com |date= |accessdate=2011-01-30}}</ref>
On 29 January 2011, news channel [[Al Arabiya]] reported that Internet connection was cut off, that was quickly denied by official sources.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dp-news.com/pages/detail.aspx?l=2&articleId=72236 |title=Internet is Available across Syria |publisher=dp-news.com |date= |accessdate=2011-01-30}}</ref>
